channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2023121119
item.description:
Report X-2023121119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-04T15:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO PACKAGE WEARING PROPER PPE, DECISION TREE IN HAND. PACKAGE LEAKING PROFUSELY ON FLOOR OF TRAILER. USING APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CONTAINED LEAKER AND TRANSPORTED TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2023120446
item.description:
Report E-2023120446

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-22
  • City: HUNTSVILLE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On December 22, 2023, one (1) 55-gallon drum of printer ink was punctured by a nail and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel deployed absorbents to the ink-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon bucket. Crews placed the damaged 55-gallon drum into one (1) 85-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2023120984
item.description:
Report X-2023120984

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: THEODORE
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found leaking in unload. Strong smell noticed by PH DescribePack: Package was found as a wet mess. A cap appears to have been loose DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Unload QA used gloves to remove leaking hazmat from unload into approved container. Hazmat trained QA alerted

item.title: Report E-2023120348
item.description:
Report E-2023120348

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-30T17:46:52+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-20
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: GROENDYKE TRANSPORT INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver noticed leak of about 10 gals of Ethanol on compartment 4 while loading. Spill occurred in a containment zone at the shipper. Driver transloaded all but 500 gallons of the products to the compartment #2. Driver departed with product loaded into compartments #1, 2, 3, and 5. Shipping rack unloaded the remaining 500 gallons in compartment #4 prior to driver departing.
